Rich Trumka embodied the soul of the labor movement ‚Äì the dignity of work, the idea that hard work should pay off for everyone.

We‚Äôve walked picket lines together and we've rallied together on behalf of workers.

In the wake of the shooting, the Dayton community came together as one ‚Äì not only to support each other, but to demand an end to gun violence and mass shootings.

They're still waiting.

We owe it to them to finally pass meaningful gun safety reform. #DaytonStrong

Two years ago, a gunman opened fire in #Dayton, killing nine people ‚Äì all in only 32 seconds.

Please take a moment to honor the victims.

Today marks the 31st anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act.
 
As we celebrate our progress, let us reaffirm that #DisabilityRights are human rights and recommit ourselves to increasing accessibility for all. #ADA31

Forced arbitration clauses are scams‚Äì and we should ban them.

If you got an email from Amazon about changing its arbitration terms, it's not because they're suddenly on your side‚Äì

They're dodging millions in court fees from over 75,000 angry customers.

It's the best thing we can do to level the playing field for workers when corporations hold all the power. https://t.co/AHkMo3fDR8

If you don't think the system is rigged against workers trying to join a union, listen to Gracie Heldman's story.

"The company ran a vicious anti‚Äêunion campaign. They told Hispanic workers they'd be deported if they supported the union.

I had co-workers who committed suicide." https://t.co/EcAsVAzc5C
